arts.ttl: Cagliari off the bottom of Serie A after win at Parma
arts.sum: The Sardinian club started the day in last place, one of only two teams yet to record a win. It started the brighter team and took a deserved lead in the 34th minute.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Parma 2-3 Cagliari: Match Report
arts.sum: Cagliari clinched their first Serie A victory of the 2024-25 season in a pulsating 3-2 away win against newly-promoted Parma on Monday night. The match saw goals from Nadir Zortea, Razvan Marin, and Roberto Piccoli for the visitors. Both teams made several changes to their starting lineups, with Parma introducing Emmanuele Valeri and Antoine Hainaut, while Cagliari brought in Adam Obert, Michel Adopo, and Nicolas Viola. The game started with early drama as Yerry Mina’s seventh-minute goal for Cagliari was disallowed for offside. arts.ttl: Parma’s Pecchia: “We’ll face a team accustomed to these moments and managing tension”
arts.sum: Parma manager Fabio Pecchia addressed the media in a press conference ahead of their upcoming match against Cagliari. Despite having only one victory so far this season, Pecchia expressed his team’s desire to turn the page and build consistency starting with the game against Cagliari. Pecchia emphasized the importance of their playing style, stating, “We must rely on our quality plays to seek goals with speed, we must trust our strengths. There will be moments when the match may take a different turn, and we’ll need to adapt. The game itself will dictate those requirements. arts.ttl: Serie A | Parma v Cagliari: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: Parma and Cagliari are set to sign off week six of Serie in the Monday night fixture, with both sides badly in need of a victory. This match marks only the second away game of the season for the Rossoblu, who are still in search of their first win under manager Davide Nicola. In contrast, the home team, led by Fabio Pecchia, come into the game with high spirits following a strong start to the campaign. arts.ttl: Parma vs. Cagliari to close out the gameweek
arts.sum: Cagliari have won six of their last nine Serie A games against Parma when facing the Ducali with fewer points in the table at the start of the MD (D2 L1), including each of the most recent three – the last of which was on 15 September 2019 (1-3 at the Tardini stadium). A clash between two sides in need of points at the Tardini: Parma haven’t won since August 24 against AC Milan whilst Cagliari are still looking for their first win of the campaign.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Parma v Cagliari: Match Preview
arts.sum: As the Serie A season approaches its second month, Parma and Cagliari find themselves in desperate need of points as they prepare to face off at Stadio Ennio Tardini on Monday evening. Both sides have endured difficult starts to the campaign, with just one league win between them, setting the stage for a tense encounter in Emilia-Romagna. Parma, back in the top flight after promotion last season, have shown flashes of promise but have struggled to convert performances into points. arts.ttl: Former Serie A star found dead in a hotel room at 43 as Cagliari pay tribute to club legend's 'professionalism, dedication and passion'
arts.sum: After growing up in the city, Capone would go on to graduate from the club's academy before becoming a regular feature in the Serie A side's midfield in the 2000s.
